reviews.text: Stayed for the last week of June 08 as part of a convention at the nearby Westin Diplomat. I was very pleased with the location, as it was quiet and more residential. (I'm not that old, but was very happy to avoid a place that was noisy/party scene all night, esp since I was there for work.) As a Starwood Gold member, was upgraded to a 1BR suite at no charge. Nice room - well equipped with full kitchen, large American-type fridge/freezer, washer/dryer, separate bedroom, and large bathroom. (Bring your own detergent for the clothes washer.) Housekeeping did an excellent job, and when I met one of the ladies as she was cleaning my room we had a nice chat. The terrace faced South, so look left and see the Atlantic, look right and see the Intracoastal. Beach itself is very nice and clean with soft sand. The lounge chairs were set up with with cushions and towelling covers, and there were umbrellas as well when it was not too windy. The pool area is more of a backyard-size, but this was not a priority for me as the beach is sooo good. As most of my trip was convention-related, I did not dine in the hotel except for one room service dinner on the night I arrived from London. The pasta was quite good, order was taken promptly and they promised "within 30 minutes" - my dinner arrived in 20 minutes, a pleasant surprise.
reviews.title: Good beach, location away from SoBe scene (good for me)

likes.liked: — Comfortable room with great beach views.
likes.disliked: — Having to work instead of going to the beach...

reviews.text: Did not have time to try the spa (sadly). The mandatory resort fee is common at all beach-side area hotels in the US which I have been to, so not a surprise. Valet-only parking is consistent with area prices (not cheap), but the attendants were quick to fetch the car and pleasant. Note that if you drive to the hotel, the turn-in is tricky - the town of Sunny Isles Beach does not allow the hotel to have good signposting. If you are coming northbound on Collins, you can turn right into the hotel just north of the Trump property and another residential complex (but before the highway overpass). The drive goes basically straight up, as the valet court is above ground level. Coming south, you will either come down the exit ramp from 192nd St or down Collins. You will have to go past the hotel, then make a u-turn. This would be at the SECOND left turning lane after the overpass/exit ramp. To walk to the Publix grocery, go out the hotel and turn left (south). It is about 5 - 7 mins walking, cross the street at a marked crossing.
reviews.title: best 10 day vacation ever

likes.disliked: — Overweight European men in speedos. Had to ask for coffe, hand towels and toilet paper every day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a good family-run and inexpensive traditional Mexican restaurant, go to the one in the RK Associates shopping centre (opposite the Marshall's discount store) which is south of the hotel at 16800 Collins Ave. Sorry can't find the card with their name on it, but it was lovely. I look forward to returning to this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Long Weekend!
Nice Hotel, but pool very small!
reviews.text: We booked this hotel through priceline for $130 a night. We were traveling with our three children so was worried about the size of the standard room. The front desk said we could upgrade to a one bedroom suite for another $75 a night I was hesitant so she called her manager over and I informed her we were there for my birthday so she said we could have it for $40 more a night wich I gladly accepted. The decision was a very good one as the full kitchen was put to good use over the 10 days, very nice granite with stainless steel appliances. Beautiful ocean views from balcony in room 1603. So many colors of blue we all agreed it was prettier water than in cancun. It was an easy 2 block walk from the publix with full handfulls of groceries. The first day had waves in the ocean with a flag out for rip current but every other day was like standing in a swimming pool the water was so clear and calm. A few very comfortable beach beds were available first come first serve basis. We were almost always able to get one at 1030 am. The beach chairs and umbrellas were nice too. Pool bar made great drinks but very pricey $25.40 every time after gratuity added in for two drinks so we got a blender at publix and rum at a liquor store three blocks away. The BICE restaraunt was exceptional both service and the food so were only able to eat there twice. Aventura mall $10 cab ride away is a very nice mall for a rainy afternoon. South beach can be reached by bus from The S line bus that stops right in front of the hotel, took about 50 minutes. South beach had deteriorated since the last time we had been there. Many homeless and a strong smell of urine at every alley. Took a cab back as it was very late $40. We were all lad to be back at Le Meridien so clean and safe feeling, hotel always smelled wonderful and the ambience was very relaxing. enjoyed the relaxing sounds they had in the elevators. All in all this is our favorite destination in the U.S. The kids even liked it better than Iberostar Parisio in Playa Del Carmen. The only place that my wife and I have enjoyed more was Grand Lido Negril but it is hard to compare all inclusives to hotels. We actually lost weight this trip as opposed to feeling obligated to eat your moneys worth at an all inclusive. All Staff very friendly and spoke good english however very few other guests spoke english, mostly europeans. We look forward to spending two weeks there next summer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were given this facility through Priceline. We were expecting a small room and no attention as was previously stated. However, we were elated with our 4 day stay at this facility. The staff was always courteous and knowledgeable. Guillermo at the Concierge was fabulous as was Christian at the bar. The restaurant and room service food was pricey, but well worth it. We would definitely return on a future trip.
reviews.title: Very disappointing

likes.disliked: — Food; service; room size; location of hotel;

reviews.text: I booked this hotel through hot wire dot com. I did not get a deal. I do not blame hot wire, I blame the hotel. When booking, it was mentioned that a $ 20 resort fee per day would be added. (This is for providing a tiny pool with a bar, and some beach chairs). The rack rate had this fee included, and thus, the rack rate was almost the same as the discount rate. A trickery by the hotel, in my opinion. Please note that there are many different room types, up to two and maybe even three bedroom condos.
reviews.title: Not a Meridien standard

reviews.text: The hotel is three years old. It is a condo hotel. Its standard is so much less than a regular Meridien. The gap between the door and the wall was a quarter of an inch. I heard doors banging the whole night. The building standard is typical for the bubble years, when they thought they could sell shoddy construction for a fortune. And Meridien agreed to lend its name, obviously.
reviews.title: Relaxing Resort on the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No soda/water machines. Walk two blocks to the market, or buy overpriced drinks at the bar. The property is tiny. The 'classic' room was tiny, you could not turn around in it. But the bathroom was generous in size.
reviews.title: Absolutely loved our stay (anniversary)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But the beach is large. In Miami, one important factor is whether a room smells moldy. This one did not, it is too new. So I enjoyed it anyhow.
reviews.title: Faux Luxury on the beach in Southeast Florida

reviews.text: This was my first trip to Miami and this hotel was recommended by a co-worker. Upon entering the hotel you immediately smell the most amazing aroma. I am not sure what it was but I enjoyed just walking in every day! The standard oceanfront room was really really small. I mean you had enough room to walk around the bed! But the view was very nice and it was very clean. The staff was very polite and extremely professional (i wished they could have lightened up a wee bit). The beach was beautiful and the service by the cabana boys was impeccable. There were not many dining options available inside the hotel but plenty outside. The valet parking is pretty expensive but very convenient. Overall a pleasant stay.
reviews.title: A few days in Sunny Isle before heading up to Orlando
**Too Far***
reviews.text: well, the hotel was average, not much different from what we had seen on the internet and in brochures, however it was simply too far from where we wanted to be which was South Beach. We were told by the hotel it was a stone throw from South Beach proir to our arrival, however the taxi prices were 40-50 dollars, and the bus took an hour though very much cheaper, sometimes it felt a bit unnerving. Room sizes were average not much room for anything rather than sleeping!! Hotel prices were unreal- so expensive for food and drink. Overall would never go back to Le Meridian or recommend it to anyone, wanting to experience Miami as it is simply too far if yoy dont have a car- which we never!!!
We wanted a relaxing 4 day beach get away for our toddler's break from school and unfortunately, everything about this hotel seemed more appropriate for short business trips.
reviews.title: Not the place for a relaxing get away, better suited for business trips

likes.disliked: — pool area and the overall decor of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted to give it a chance as Le Meridien in general has a fairly good reputation for it's cleanliness and style, but for some reason this particular location managed to miss all of the good qualities that we expect from Meridien. Here are the reasons.
reviews.title: Tiny classic rooms

likes.liked: — The beach - and chair and umbrella service
likes.disliked: — The little room, and no ice or coffee makers.

reviews.text: 1. The main entrance itself is unwelcoming. The doorman and the bell hop couldn't even crack a smile,say a simple hello or offer to help out with unloading the luggage from the trunk of a taxi. The outdated and confusing dark tinted glass entrance door leads you to a cold,narrow and uninviting lobby area that resembles a high rising office building or a bank.(there is an ATM machine right next to front desk)
reviews.title: Excellent Pet Friendly Hotel

likes.liked: — The excellent service and pet friendly ammentities.
likes.disliked: — Couldn't walk to eat / condition of carpets.

reviews.text: 2. The "Ocean View Suite" didn't have the ocean view, but rather you get a view of sadly over developed urban Miami high risings complete with plenty of construction sights, truly depressing. The only way for you to get a glimpse of the ocean is for you to go out to the balcony.(if you or your kids don't mind looking over and around a dizzying height on a windy high rising balcony)
reviews.title: Overall pretty good.....BUT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I booked a suite at Le Meridien on Sunny Isles Beach and loved it! The hotel upon walking in is classy, clean and contemporary. Very airy. The staff was attentive and polite and very proffesional. The room made us go "wow!". It was beautiful. The bed was comfortale and the kitchen had stainless steel appliances ( Fridge, Dish washer, Stove, Oven) The room was exactly the way it was depicted on their website. The balcony had a partial ocean and city view and it was perfect. We had dinner on the balcony on one of the nights and enjoyed the tranquility and the Ocean breeze. The bed was so comfortable, we never woke up once during the night, and the restroom was huge, modern. The living room area was so comfortable with the modern decor, the plasma tv and the nice eating area. Basically we felt like we were at a luxurious home away from home :) The beachfront area was amazing. It was not crowded at all. ( we'd go down at around noon time) The $16/day fee that they charge you is for the use of their umbrellas,Big fluffy towels and beach lounge chairs that they bring out and set up for you each and everytime. It was just amazing. The street that the hotel is on Collins Ave. is a strip of Luxury Beachfront hotels that bring even more allure to it all. There is a Super Market a block away and several restaurants etc. We will definitely go back to Le Meridien it was a memorable hotel and is exactly what a luxury hotel should be. :)
reviews.title: We LOVED Le Meridien!!!!!

likes.liked: — The rooms were absolutely beautiful and exactly the way the website depicts them
likes.disliked: — I guess the $25/day rate for a car if you have one.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are Starwood time share owners and decided to use some points for a long weekend in Miami. Only about a half hour drive from Fort Lauderdale airport, this hotel is about a half hour away from Miami Beach. The hotel itself was very classy, we were greeted courteously at check-in although I did have to wait about 10 mins while another vacationer took up the only check-in girls time with a hundred questions - I tried to be patient as I was already in vacation mode! Our room was more of a suite with a georgous kitchen that I'd like to have at home with granite countertops, that opened to a nice sitting room with LCD TV and a great balcony. Our room was very nice, a little small but adequate, had another TV. The bathroom was huge - very nice and the robes were luxurious - they had a really cute note attached to them just in case anyone tried to stuff it in their suitcase. The staff were generally very helpful and eager to please and overall we had a great time and would definately go back.b
reviews.title: Classy Hotel

likes.disliked: — the drive up the driveway - better be a good driver!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My bf and i wanted to go away for our two year.... we deff wanted to go somewhere where they had a spa....
reviews.title: Nice........

likes.disliked: — our room was not ready when promissed we had to wait 1/2 hr

reviews.text: The spa was amazing!! they spent days calling back to make sure things were what i wanted........ we had a romantic champan toast while we watched the waves.... and had chocolate covered strawberries.....
reviews.title: Good time iwth kids at Le Meridien sunny isles beach, fl

likes.liked: — great room, great views, good facility
likes.disliked: — Lackluster service after checkin, high resort and parking fees

reviews.text: the room was small but nice.. it lacked some amenities, they told you to fill out a breakfast card but there was no pen, it took them
reviews.title: Dysfunctional to use as a beach vacation
